result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregg M Shiver

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

(Cases 22CF807, 22CF999, 22CF1190, 22CM617 are called at 10:28 AM) Defendant Gregg M Shiver in court, in custody with Attorney Roger M Hillestad.  Attorney Loralee Clark in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements in 22CF807, 22CF999, 22CM617, but not 22CF1190. Defense indicates there is an agreement in cases 22CF807, 22CF999, 22CM617- PSI recommended. Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CF807 Count 2- Substantial Battery Use of a Dangerous Weapon as Domestic, Count 4- Felony Intimidation of a Victim as Domestic, Count 8- Felony Intimidation of a Victim as Domestic, and Count 10- Possession of Firearm by a Felon. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Victim (A.S.) makes a statement. Court accepts pleas and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in, including all of 22CF999, 22CM617. Court removes the jury trial and status conference from the calendar. 
Court orders a Presentence Investigation due 12/09/2022. Defense indicates they intends to provide an alternate PSI memorandum- due 12/09/2022. 
Sentencing Hearing in 22CF807, 22CF999, 22CM617: 12/22/2022 at 10:30 AM (IN PERSON- set for 1 hour). 
22CF1190- 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 11/09/2022 at 2:00 PM. 
Hearing: 11/30/2022 at 9:30 AM.
Final status/scheduling conference on October 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:00 PM cases 22CF807, 22CF999, 22CM617 called. All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom.  Attorney Loralee Clark appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gregg M Shiver appeared by video, in custody from Eau Claire County Jail without counsel. 

2:04 PM: Attorney Roger M Hillestad appeared by phone for Gregg M Shiver. Defendant wishes to continue hearing with Attorney Hillestad representing him.

Defense makes argument for modification to signature bond. State objects and makes argument and requested increase of cash bond. Court denies Defendant's request for bond modification and orders bonds remain as is. Defendant requests speedy trial demand in 22CF807. In 22CF999 time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 

Final Status Conference set for 10/27/2022 at 10:30 AM (in person)

Pre-Trial Conference set for 11/29/2022 at 8:30 AM (in person) and Jury selection to begin at 9:00 AM.

Trial (3 day) set for 11/29/2022-12/01/2022

Case 22CF999 and 22CM617 to ride along.

Proposed Order to Withdraw
By Attorney Roger Hillestad

Defense's Motion to Reduce Bond
Filed by defendant, received via USPS Mail.
Dated 07/31/2022, letter from defendant to Court regarding phone privileges.
Motion hearing on September 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

(4:16 PM cases 22CM617, 22CF807 called.) Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Gregg M Shiver in court, in custody. Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Gregg M Shiver.
Parties advise are ready to proceed.
22CF807:
State calls Officer Marcus Walden of the Eau Claire Police Department, who is sworn and testifies.
Attorney Hillestad conducts cross-examination of Officer Walden. Witness excused.
State moves for bind over. Attorney Hillestad has no argument.
Court finds probable cause and binds the case over.
Court addresses defendant's letter regarding no contact which was ordered in Court versus the order which was signed. Court advises an Amended Order has been signed.
Defendant requests to address bond modification. Court advises to have Attorney draft a motion for bond modification.
Attorney Hillestad to schedule 22CF807 for an Arraignment and 22CM617 for a Hearing with the Branch 3 Judicial Assistant as case 22CM617 is riding along with 22CF807.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: SPD Appointment - Attorney Roger Hillestad
Hearing on August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cases called at 2:29 PM: 22CF807, 22CM617.
Defendant Gregg M Shiver in court, in custody without counsel.  Attorney Loralee Clark in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court notes that the Public Defender's Office has been unable to appoint counsel for the Defendant.
Preliminary Hearing adjourned to 8/2/22 at 2:00 PM.
Defendant requests the bond be amended to $1,000-$5,000 Cash or Signature Bond.
State objects. Victim is present and makes a statement to the Court. Court denies the motion to modify bond.
State filed motion to restrict the Defendant's phone calls from the jail. Court does not restrict phone calls but reiterates the no contacts that are currently in place.
The Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender Services. Despite best efforts, the State Public Defender Office has not yet secured representation for this Defendant.

(11:08 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Gregg M Shiver appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Katherine Cook appeared by video for Gregg M Shiver. 
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint.
State requests $10,000.00 cash bond to be encompassed as part of the $20,000.00 cash bond in 22CF807.
Court orders $10,000.00 cash bond with conditions and advises the defendant's total bond is NOT $30,000.00 cash, the total to be posted to allow the defendant to be released is $20,000.00 cash. The $10,000.00 cash bond ordered is encompassed as part of the $20,000.00 cash bond in 22CF807.
Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation.
Hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Conditions:
No contact with A.S., G.S. Jr., M.S., C.A. or anyone at the phone numbers of the residence.
(Part of bond in 22CF807)
